TESTING = False¶
class gravitate.config.GravitateConfig[source]¶

Bases: object

TESTING: (authenticate decorator will return uid as the value of header[“Authentication”])
Enable testing mode. Exceptions are propagated rather than handled by the the app’s error handlers. Extensions may also change their behavior to facilitate easier testing. You should enable this in your own tests.
DEBUG:
Whether debug mode is enabled. When using flask run to start the development server, an interactive debugger will be shown for unhandled exceptions, and the server will be reloaded when code changes. The debug attribute maps to this config key. This is enabled when ENV is ‘development’ and is overridden by the FLASK_DEBUG environment variable. It may not behave as expected if set in code.

Note that this Config currently does not affect (Flask) main.app CONFIG. TODO: extend from Flask Config and apply to main.app

APP_NAME = None¶
DEBUG = None¶
FIREBASE_CERTIFICATE_JSON_PATH = None¶
TESTING = None¶

gravitate.context module¶

Author: Zixuan Rao Reference: https://github.com/Amsterdam/subsidieservice/blob/master/subsidy_service/subsidy_service/context.py

Usage: 1. In testing or production, initialize Context singleton first by calling config.Context.read() in __init__.py of

caller package
  1. In package (test_data_access as an example) __init__.py, add “import config”
  2. In files under the package: CTX = test_data_access.config.Context

gravitate.main module¶

class gravitate.main.EndpointTestService[source]¶

Bases: flask_restful.Resource

endpoint = 'endpointtestservice'¶
mediatypes()¶
method_decorators = [<function authenticate>]¶
methods = {'POST'}¶
post(uid)[source]¶
  • This method handles a POST/PUT call to ‘./authTest’ to test that front end Auth
    is set up correctly.
If the id_token included in ‘Authorization’ is verified, the user id (uid)
corresponding to the id_token will be returned along with other information.

Otherwise, an exception is thrown

gravitate.main.add_noauth_test_data()[source]¶
Description
This endpoint receives a REST API “post_json” call and stores the
json in database collection contextText. If set up correctly, the client receives the id of the json inserted.

Note that this call does not test Auth token.

Raises:
Return type:
